Ok people one of the longest-standing PRs is finally merged, and we now have text in screen-space! This means one can use `text!` more intuitively, and specify the text size independent of data scaling, while specifying the position in terms of data. Previously, the text would be squished. Here's one simple example:

```data = cumsum(randn(1000))
lines(data)
text!("maximum", position = reverse(findmax(data)))
text!("minimum", position = reverse(findmin(data)), align = (:left, :top))
current_figure()```
